column5:
From a stay at home mom who tried to do the divorce DIY, DO NOT DO THAT. Absolutely get a lawyer. It‚Äôs about 50/50 on lawyers who charge a fee for consultations. A good lawyer is worth their weight in gold. My lawyer was amazing. I wasn‚Äôt trying to fuck my ex over, I just wanted what I was legally entitled to! And I got it. I got spousal support, half of his retirement rolled into my own, 50/50 custody, etc. 

Gather as much info as you can as far as bank statements, mortgage papers, ALL debt and assets, retirement, taxes, etc. Having these will help your case. Tell your  lawyer what you want. There are protections and social services available to you, educate yourself so you can make the best decisions for you and the kids. Good luck‚ù§Ô∏è

This is me, too. I‚Äôve done a couple of figure competitions (you can check my post history), what you can do is back off your leg work a bit and focus more on upper body. I had two back and two shoulder days, only one leg day. I had one heavy day (rep range 4-6), and a high rep day (reps 15-30). I saw incredible growth in my lats and shoulders. 

I also backed off a lot of quad exercises and focused on hamstrings/weak gluteal points, and abs. This helped balance me out muscle-wise, so when I shredded for my competition my legs were more defined yet didn‚Äôt take over my physique, and my shoulders were üòç

You look fantastic! Keep up the good work.

Nice work! I‚Äôm in recovery from alcohol abuse. Never had a problem at all with alcohol till I left my ex husband w my two kids about 3 years ago, and my addiction was full fledged. Still a struggle, but I have no desire to go back to living like that. Keep up the good work, thanks for the inspiration today.
It‚Äôs so easy to become tolerant. Give yourself a week off very now and then. It can be rough, but worth it. Your receptors just gets desensitized and they need a break.
I love Dublin. Great shot.

This is so true. We often don‚Äôt see the rewards of our hard work till later, this applies to most areas in life. Yesterday I had a moment in a very stressful situation. I was tired, which makes it harder for me to regulate my emotions, and as I was in this emotional tizzy, I was able to stop and calm myself down! I breathed, consciously relaxed my shoulders. I was honestly a bit shocked at the tension that was throughout my entire body. I had never really realized it till that moment. 

Recognize the times you DO have improvements. Yesterday I thought ‚Äúwow this is working!‚Äù during that situation, bc in the past I would have spent the rest of the evening, or at least hours, in that heightened emotional state. To a person without CPTSD it seems like nothing... but to me, it was a battle won. It‚Äôs good to recognize our triumphs, even if they seem small to others.

I find Zumba actually kind of difficult for me, but belly dance was my jam. I LOVE it. It‚Äôs sexy, fun, playful, and the coin scarfs are super fun. It felt much more natural for me and I enjoyed it more. Zumba just makes me frustrated üòÇ Or, better yet, I just do dance parties with my kids who thankfully don‚Äôt care what I look like.
Yes! I‚Äôve been meaning to read that thanks for the reminder.

Absolutely. In now call it a gift born out of trauma... but I am rarely, if ever, wrong about people and who they really are. I can feel the moment someone‚Äôs feelings have shifted. This is from 20+ years of having to guess and pander to everyone else‚Äôs emotions. I had to predict and pamper my step mom and ex husbands every need or want, and if I didn‚Äôt I would be punished. But, now i am free, and I have this amazing intuition that I‚Äôm learning to appreciate and trust.

Girl. I JUST broke up with my bf for similar reasons. The ‚Äúsymptoms‚Äù were a bit different but similar. He also just could not keep me in the loop about anything. I felt like a control freak too, like is this necessary for him to tell me when/if he‚Äôs coming over to my place? It is absolutely reasonable to give someone a heads up. He needs total ‚Äúfreedom of movement,‚Äù doesn‚Äôt matter that this means he is disrespecting my time and space. He is very selfish, but it is not my job to teach a 31y old how to balance his life. And I‚Äôm not willing to wait for him to get his shit together.

Ha! Girl just do you. Currently sitting at my desk half-working in my giant fluffy robe. Haven‚Äôt washed my hair in a few days, though I did shower last night. I see nobody most days, and only see my boss couple times a week (our main office is at her house luckily). She and I sit around in our lounge wear at her place too!! Just do what you need to do. Every day could be different. We are all different people, coping in different ways. For some people getting dressed up and putting on make up brings a sense of normalcy to these strange times. But if that doesn‚Äôt do it for you, no big deal. Epsom salt baths have been a life saver for me personally.

How‚Äôs that? I‚Äôm making fun of myself more than anything... I‚Äôm kinda a hermit who worked from home anyway, just live a fairly low maintenance lifestyle in general. I joined this sub to learn more about reducing waste not to judge others.
Awesome thanks!

Same here. I‚Äôm 32y female, no underlying health conditions. Take no medications. Take vitamins regularly. I workout several times a week, I‚Äôm a personal trainer in addition to my day job. I‚Äôm fit, active, healthy. I contracted the virus and it also knocked me on my ass for 2 solid weeks. In addition to your symptoms I also had visual disturbances due to brain swelling, another big symptom. Also lost my sense of taste and smell for a couple days. This was this absolute sickest I‚Äôve been since I was a child.

We are in network with BCBS and base our fee schedule off that. We often just charge people their copay/co ins on the office visit only, and the hands on work she does (like osteopathic manipulations or manual therapy) we only charge insurance. We make it affordable on a case by case basis, offering discounts and pay plans to those without insurance. We believe medical/mental health is a human right and not a product. It should be available to all, not just rich people or those with insurance.

Anyone in integrative care. I work for a family physician who takes a holistic approach and LISTENS to her patients. Our patients get an entire hour with her, sometimes more. She listens and actually cares about people.
He also will owe you 4 years of back child support.

I went solo to Prague and Dublin last year. First time in Europe, first big solo trip. I cannot tell you how grateful I am I travelled when I did. Who knows what the coming months and years will bring.

Yes thank you! I get frustrated when I see this same sentiment over and over. Eat real, whole food for a month and tell me you don‚Äôt feel better. Our bodies very much react to food on a molecular level. The best I‚Äôve ever felt in my life was eating a super clean bodybuilding diet full of fresh veggies and fruits of every color, lean meat, eggs, rice, etc, and no wheat, dairy, or sugar except occasional cheese, and one cheat meal a week. I had tons of energy, was really strong, recovered well, and my gut issues all but disappeared. Micronutrients matter too, people!
Thank you üôèüèº

Two weeks tomorrow is when it really hit me.

And thanks. We‚Äôve both been through a lot, separate and together. I‚Äôm not the easiest to handle, I have CPTSD and he‚Äôs always been patient and loving with me. It‚Äôs so hard, bc part of me thinks, I‚Äôve put him through really hard times, and he‚Äôs always helped me through. We‚Äôve had conversations, he seems sincere. But he‚Äôs actually burned me before, and my ex did too after I gave him another chance. But I have been given multiple chances too. I‚Äôm no saint. It‚Äôs just really, really hard for me to trust people, so when someone in my inner circles fucks me over it takes me a long time to recover. 

Thanks for reading if you did, hard being all cooped up üòÇ

I work for an MD in a city of 300-400k. We both became very sick, doctor was worried bc she saw patients the week before. We immediately close the clinic (this was way before any mandates), she calls the CDC and her doctor friends at the hospital. She doesn‚Äôt fit the CDC criteria even tho she is a provider who has had recent contact with patients. So into self quarantine we both go. 

That was over two weeks ago. After having low oxygen, tachycardia, and almost going to the ER, they finally relent and give her one of the 800 tests that was given to our state. It came back negative, but there have been many false negatives on those shot tests, plus perhaps her viral load is just low. Who knows? She and her doc friends are all certain we both have it. 

We also have many, many high risk patients who have gotten ill, all with the same/similar symptoms. Almost none of them can get tests bc they don‚Äôt ‚Äúqualify...‚Äù aka aren‚Äôt quite sick enough. Last I heard from the hospital, which was a memo last week, there were 400 tests left in my city. They did set up one drive thru testing center, but it is a HUGE pain. 

Trump is a liar. It‚Äôs right there in black and white! I cannot comprehend the mental gymnastics it takes to hear ‚ÄúMILLIONS OF BEAUTIFUL PERFECT TESTS‚Äù and then to hear, hey actually we only have 800 tests for an entire state! And we haven‚Äôt received any more!!

Just found out my bf lied to me. We have an open relationship, was going well. Then found out he‚Äôs been texting this chick from work for three. Fucking. Months. Now, this breaks several of the rules/boundaries we BOTH agreed on. So I‚Äôm possibly going through a break up during the quarantine ... oh yeah and I have covid. I‚Äôm a 30 something healthy, fit, active woman, and this thing has laid me on my fucking ass. It‚Äôs been the strangest disease. And then I found out my rock is just like every other man and I can‚Äôt trust him. So that‚Äôs been fun.

Oh yes. Did your parents read ‚Äúgrowing kids gods way‚Äù? All about children being ‚Äútrained‚Äù like good dogs, obeying authority without question every moment of every day. It‚Äôs horrible and toxic and I‚Äôm glad I‚Äôm not raising my kids that way.
Really beautiful!

Bernies too... there was a shooting New Year‚Äôs Eve a couple years ago, scary as hell bc I was there mere hour or two before it happened. Williwaw seems to have tighter security. Also avoid Gaslight though I‚Äôve had some good times there üòÇ

Great post but you didn‚Äôt mention glaciers!  There are so many glaciers you can hike to, walk on, fly too, etc. there‚Äôs Byron Glacier right outside of Anchorage. I went to Schoup Glacier and stayed at a cabin that you had to take a water taxi (or kayak) too. Really phenomenal time there. 

I‚Äôve lived in AK for 12 years, Anchorage for most that time but also lived in Wasilla and Fairbanks. I‚Äôm a single woman who lives downtown and can verify this place is very dangerous. You will see homeless camps everywhere (there‚Äôs two huge ones within a couple hundred feet of my place). 

Keep your wits about you, especially when drinking downtown. There are regular stabbings/shootings at the bars, and clubs are constantly closing bc of the violence. You will not find the magic of Alaska in Anchorage. However like OP said there‚Äôs many, many trails. I went on Rabbit Lake Trail yesterday and it was phenomenal. The view was incredible. Anyone feel free to PM me with questions.

Same here. I had a total mental break two nights ago and have been feeling deep shame since. I have a really good support system for the first time so it‚Äôs hard for me to comprehend being loved and accepted through this.

I feel this very much. Life is going so well, why do I feel so angry/irritated/etc... My therapist and my friend who I confide in both said bc when you feel safe, that‚Äôs when the trauma will surface so you can deal with it. So much of our lives have been lived in survival mode. So when we cross over to thriving mode, all that crap we‚Äôve suppressed just to live comes bubbling up. It‚Äôs exhausting and supremely frustrating. I‚Äôm 32, with my own business and single mom to two gorgeous, healthy kids, I have an amazing boyfriend that I have a hard time trusting bc of my past issues. It sucks. I‚Äôm considering breaking up so he just doesn‚Äôt have to deal with my BS anymore. If I‚Äôm sick and tired of it I can‚Äôt think what he must deal with, with these annoying, random mood swings and such. He tries his best to assure me, and I‚Äôll feel ok for a day or two, then the cycle happens all over again!!! 

I found the one thing that has ever really helped was tripping on mushrooms. Wow. I had a great trip, and felt AMAZING for MONTHS. I‚Äôm talking no anxiety/panic attacks, no consuming anxiety, I wasn‚Äôt in my own head and freaking out over every little thing. I was more patient and kind w the kids. I have a therapeutic LSD trip planned for this weekend. There‚Äôs a lot of research available regarding how psychedelics are very effective in treating CPTSD. I can say from personal experience it‚Äôs helps.
I related to this SO much when I first saw it. Exactly what it felt like to me.
Congrats!! I just came out as bi at 32yrs old. Not to most my family bc of their toxicity, but a lot of my close friends know. Very freeing üòÅ
I personally would destroy him. We don‚Äôt need more pieces of shit like him in office. You have incredible POWER here. Go to his opponent and/or the media. Good luck ‚ù§Ô∏è

This was me, 100%. I love being a single mom. I had two babies under 2, and one that was late 30s. It was horrible. It‚Äôs still a lot of work, but I dont have dead weight anymore. In fact, my bf is pretty damn great and never needs to be asked to do anything. He doesn‚Äôt live w me but spends the night a lot. He will wash the dishes, clean the kitchen, sweep the floor, take out trash, and switch over laundry and tells me to go sit and relax while he does the chores. He‚Äôs a sweetheart ‚ù§Ô∏è
She‚Äôs doesn‚Äôt have to give them her details, just that the provider was shitty. Insurance companies don‚Äôt want to work with shit providers, either.

This is the answer. No need to make extensive lists and sit down to have a ‚Äúrespectful‚Äù chat. Just simply stop doing his shit! I had to do this when I was a SAHM. My ex (lots of reasons he‚Äôs an ex, and this was one of them), used to just throw his dirty clothes in the floor, right next to the fucking hamper. I asked him so nicely several times. Finally one day I snapped and I said ‚ÄúIf you don‚Äôt put your clothes in the hamper I will stop washing them. I‚Äôm not your mom. I already have two kids. I don‚Äôt mind washing, drying, and folding for you, but be a grown man and throw them in the hamper please.‚Äù 

What do you know a week later he had no clean socks! He was livid. I calmly reminded him what I said. He never threw shit on the floor after that ‚ò∫Ô∏è

Girl. I was in your exact situation. Two young children, he worked, wouldn‚Äôt allow me to work outside the home. I fortunately still worked from home. But the more money I made the more he‚Äôd make me pay towards bills. He‚Äôd go over the CC statement and go line by line and make me hand over money for food, diapers, etc. I was being abused financially, mentally, emotionally. He berated me for everything. House was dirty, kids behaved badly, my food sucked. He started eating out for every meal. Oh yeah, AND he was cheating on me w other men for our entire relationship! 

I finally couldn‚Äôt handle it. I called a local abused women‚Äôs shelter and got the fuck out! I was able to live w a friend w my kids for two months while I worked my ass off to save money. If you go to a shelter they will help you fill out paperwork. I took a month of welfare, also got food stamps, child care assistance, etc. When you go to court to divorce his ass you will get alimony. There‚Äôs also a possibility of getting him to pay for and support you while you go back to school. 

You are worth so much more than this. For your health and safety, and for your kids, you need to leave. You CAN do this. He‚Äôs told you for years how terrible you are. But guess what?? He‚Äôs a fucking liar. You are amazing and a badass, and someday you will be thriving, not just surviving. 

Feel free to PM me if you have any questions or need any help. Good luck mama. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
They totally are! Not sure where you got that info from. Each therapist has their credentials listed.
Online therapy is affordable. Check out BetterHelp.com.

Yes, that‚Äôs pretty much what you need to do. Most employees need you to ‚Äúprove‚Äù that you‚Äôre competent until they can trust you to be remote. It took a couple years for me to be able to work up to being independent. Good luck, it‚Äôs a fantastic job.

I have been a CPC though AAPC and biller for 12 yrs. I have my own company. It‚Äôs quite challenging finding remote work as a biller or coder with zero experience. Especially working remote from outside the US. Do you have any medical admin experience at all?

Congrats!!! The best thing I ever did was get a divorce. We do have two children, so I have to stay in communication with him for forever, but we are both in a much better place. I‚Äôm crazy happy with my boyfriend, and he‚Äôs someone I can trust. He‚Äôs got his shit together, is an actual grown man,  but is super goofy. We joke and laugh all the time, and the sex is out of this world. 

It‚Äôs ok to grieve the death of your marriage. Even though I knew it was right, and I was so happy to be away from him, it still hurt. I felt like a failure even though, like you, I was a great spouse and did everything I could to keep our family together. 

Enjoy your freedom and your new life ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Wait, what year is it?! Jesus, lady I‚Äôm sorry your husband and his family are stuck in the 50s and are complete assholes. üôÑ baby girls are amazing, enjoy your beautiful, healthy baby ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

A lot of people talk like that bc they are jealous and feel bad about themselves. You are strong and competent. Fuck everyone else. You have to just let it roll off your back. Nice work, lady üí™üèº

The only reason therapy was good for me in my abusive marriage was bc it really opened my eyes to holy shit, he‚Äôs fucking abusing me!!! I ended up seeing ‚Äúour‚Äù therapist on my own bc he actively sabotaged nearly every appointment. I‚Äôm so thankful for my therapist who referred me to another therapist more equipped to help me, and she also helped me with an escape plan. 

Narc abusers never change. Their brains are just fucked up. My ex would accuse me and the therapist of hanging up on him ‚Äúand making him feel like an asshole.‚Äù I told him maybe it‚Äôs bc you ARE an asshole. I left his ass July 2017 and haven‚Äôt looked back.

Is there an abused women‚Äôs shelter nearby? Tell them you have a plan but are scared bc he may know and will retaliate if he looks through your account. Good luck, it‚Äôs really hard leaving an abusive situation.

Exactly why I am now self employed. I can‚Äôt stand being a slave to a corporation who tells me when I can take a break, when I can take off work, and penalties for leaving early or taking a day off to pick up sick kids, etc. I have more time to actually live life and not be constrained to arbitrary timetables.
Totally! After I dumped my toxic family and surrounded myself with actual loving people, my life dramatically improved!

Eat. More. You have to eat. Can a builder make a house out of nothing? No. He needs materials, wood, nails, concrete, and a million other things. Your body cannot make something out off nothing. Muscle won‚Äôt appear. You have to feed those muscles with good nutrition and shape them with weightlifting. Back off on cardio. Cardio is necessary for overall health, but if you‚Äôre doing that much cardio, you need to eat even more or you‚Äôre just spinning your wheels. 

I was terrified to eat more. But when I got serious about lifting I had to get serious about nutrition. A good place to start is eating 1g protein per lbs of body weight. If you‚Äôre 134lbs, eat 134g protein. You can look through my post history to see my transformation. I was eating nearly 2500 cals/day and lifting 5-6 days a week with about 10-12m of HIIT cardio couple times a week. For reference I‚Äôm just under 5‚Äô4‚Äù and when transforming about 140 lbs to start. 

Also, be gentle w yourself. Building muscle, esp for women, takes time. You have a great base now of consistency, which is HUGE. I know this sub hates on personal trainers, but what took my fitness to the next level was hiring an experienced, knowledgable trainer. A good trainer will show you proper form, will push you out of your comfort zone, and will take you to the next level. I love fitness so much that at 30yrs old became a trainer myself! I love training and fitness, it completely changed my life and who I am. I have helped transform lives, and nothing has given me so much satisfaction. 

Good luck lady. Remember fitness is a marathon, not a sprint. At leas than a year in you are doing great! Now it‚Äôs time to take it up a notch. You‚Äôve got this!!!
Don‚Äôt stop being who you are. You‚Äôre perfect. Don‚Äôt sacrifice the very core of who you are for anyone. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

This is why I went no contact with my abusive step mom and low contact w my enabler father. Dad asked me when we can ‚Äúbury the hatchet‚Äù and I told him fucking never until she can acknowledge how she abused me and my sisters, even after I left the house. 

They are not worth your time and energy. Get a good therapist and work on loving yourself. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
Recovering Christian here. It‚Äôs bc they want to control your body and your sexuality. Sex is bad until you‚Äôre married. Then you‚Äôre just supposed to procreate until your uterus falls out.
Maybe see a therapist? Even if you travel or move your underlying issues will follow you until you confront and deal with them.

Look into a sustainable way of eating. Starving and working out all the time is not sustainable. Learn to eat in a way that you can maintain a healthy weight, still have ‚Äúcheat‚Äù meals or eat and drink at a party without it completely derailing your life.

Maybe take the advice many people have given you. There IS respite care and residential services. Take care of yourself first, get the kids some actual professional care. You haven‚Äôt responded to anyone offering that advice.

Just a tip about competing: get you a coach who doesn‚Äôt take you to dangerous lows. Any body type can compete. It‚Äôs a matter of gaining enough muscle then leaning out, not too slow but not to quickly either. Slowly decreasing calories and increasing cardio. I felt fine and never ate less than 1400 calories.
Because your vagina is different than the rest of your body. People who are allergic to gluten can rub it on themselves but not ingest it.
Allergy or sensitivity to semen is a thing. Also seamen can wreck the ph balance of your vagina. If it was good before w condoms then use condoms or don‚Äôt let him cum inside you.
I bought two of the older version last year, one for me and my boyfriend for Christmas! We love them! This one is beautiful as well.
Why, though?

Are you fucking kidding me? I would never leave my child, male or female, with someone I didn‚Äôt know. Fuck those parents for not letting the mom know someone else would be watching the kids!!! No fucking way. Always trust your gut, bc a lot of times our subconscious brains pick up on signs our ‚Äúlogical‚Äù brains don‚Äôt.

Dude, you are a grown ass woman. You don‚Äôt have to go anywhere or be with anyone unless you so choose. 

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt enjoy these trips, I‚Äôd rather stay home with friends and family who enjoy my company.‚Äù

‚ÄúSorry, have to work.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo, I‚Äôm ok thanks, can‚Äôt make it.‚Äù

You are able to block phone numbers and people on social media. Why are you allowing your dad to bully you? Hang up if he gets annoying. Don‚Äôt respond to texts,  delete them. Be a grown up. Who gives a flying fuck what they say behind your back? How does it even affect your daily life? It‚Äôs time to be a big girl. I know it sucks, I went no contact with my dad and stepmom because they are annoying and judgmental and abusive. I spend my precious time and money on people who love and respect me.

This is such fantastic advice. My advice in addition would be to make sure that you keep the evidence far away from home. My narcissistic step mom seemed to find my journal no matter where I hid it. She‚Äôs make me read it, humiliate me, and make me tear out pages. 

I wish I had those journals detailing the abuse, and that I could have given them to someone. I did go to a school counselor after I tried to self harm, and was able to get out of their house and live with a trusted adult who was not in my step moms reach. Unfortunately it didn‚Äôt last too long bc step mom became enraged I was doing so well and wanted me to be w friends or family that were also being manipulated by her. 

Childhood was rough, but I‚Äôm grateful I got out. I‚Äôm now a business owner, mom, and have amazing friends. There is hope. Just keep living, your focus on surviving one more day, and eventually you will be out and you will find your own family in whatever form that takes.

You can do whatever you want. I change it up a lot. Sometimes I‚Äôll grow it out a bit, sometimes I shave completely. I try to keep in mind that my lover‚Äôs face will be down there, so I keep it trimmed and neat. As someone who enjoys both men and women I will say I like having it a bit more trim as everything is easier to access. And as a women I can tell you shaving the undercarriage will make it much more pleasurable (can actually feel tongue and everything on skin without a hair barrier), but like to keep some up top.
So.... maybe go to your doc?? That‚Äôs a long time to be sick....

So true. My stepmom was a narcissist who relentlessly abused me and my sisters. I finally, blissfully went no contact in my late 20s. She then spent the next 2-3 yrs trying to look like a saint. She used my dad, her enabler, to call me and tell me how ‚Äúsorry‚Äù she was, and when can we ‚Äújust bury the hatchet?‚Äù You know what, NEVER. I work my ass off in therapy so I‚Äôm not like her, so I don‚Äôt have to carry those wounds around forever. My life has only improved since.

Your child would be better off never seeing her. Don‚Äôt ever feel like you have to facilitate that relationship. Especially if she‚Äôs threatened you.... that‚Äôs grounds for NC. You don‚Äôt need that. Your child definitely doesn‚Äôt need that.
Naw. No guilt required. You needed a bit of a break. Our bodies and minds can only handle so much stress, and sometimes something just has to give. Now you have more time so get back to it!‚ò∫Ô∏è

And thats why I got a divorce‚ò∫Ô∏è Besides the whole cheating thing which was bad enough, he was a huge dick who never helped, didn‚Äôt even fucking clean up after himself, while I stayed home and did 100% of all house and child care. He‚Äôd go to bars with friends, took vacations out of state and fishing trips overnight while I wasn‚Äôt allowed to even go get coffee or a movie w a friend or by myself unless someone else watched the kids. Even then I was ‚Äúselfish, bad mom.‚Äù It was such enraging bullshit. Talking doesn‚Äôt help, bc these men don‚Äôt care about their women getting free time, that‚Äôs what we are there for, to serve them and the children. It‚Äôs a respect issue. Now he is forced to take care of his own children :) I‚Äôm 1000x happier, I have total control of my finances and my life like never before.

I used to, yes. I am 32 now, and I had my childhood and teens stolen from me too. But you know what? I have my own business. Two gorgeous children. An amazing boyfriend. AND right now I‚Äôm sitting in a castle in Dublin, it‚Äôs my first time in Europe and I‚Äôm doing it solo. You‚Äôve got this!!! You are young. There IS life and love and adventure ahead of you. You‚Äôre going to have to work for it. But it is so, so worth it ‚ù§Ô∏è Jeep going to therapy, take it slow, and be kind to yourself. You‚Äôve got this.
I get really red and sweaty too, and I‚Äôm in great shape. I just don‚Äôt care üòÇ I‚Äôm working hard, it‚Äôs the way my body is ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

I dunno. I never got over it when I found my ex husband had cheated on me over our entire relationship. He was pissed I wasnt over it within a couple weeks. Till the day I left (about a year later) he absolutely disgusted me. I did have sex with him, but I was never aroused and we had to use lube for the first time. I couldn‚Äôt even look at him during, I‚Äôd close my eyes or look elsewhere. 

The fact he did it 3 more times, lied, etc, and now is pressuring you shows he has no remorse. Has he done anything to try to mend the relationship? Are y‚Äôall in therapy? Are you happy? It‚Äôs your decision obviously, but I vowed I‚Äôd never be w a cheater again. Maybe some people can get over that, but the cheating mixed with lying just isn‚Äôt something I can get over or work through.
Thank you. ‚ù§Ô∏è I struggle with mental illness due to the abuse, but I‚Äôm in therapy and trying desperately to heal so I don‚Äôt inflict the same pain on my children.

Honestly, people just have to find out for themselves. You have to be ready to make that change. And it takes trial and error. Does she have binge eating disorder? It‚Äôs possible she DOES eat 1k calories a day but then has huge binges that puts her over. Classic restrict/binge cycle. Be gentle and be there for her. Someday hopefully it‚Äôll click for her. I‚Äôm a personal trainer and I can‚Äôt tell you how many clients I have that SWEAR up and down they ‚Äúeat healthy‚Äù yet are overweight or obese. They neglect to acknowledge that they drink frappes from Starbucks every morning, or drink and eat excessively on weekends. I can‚Äôt force anyone. All I can do is gently ask questions from time to time and lead them to the answer in a roundabout way. When you confront someone head on they will become defensive and possibly cut you out. Just continue to be her friend and if she asks questions about how you‚Äôre able to lose and she can‚Äôt, ask how she does on the weekends or when she‚Äôs stressed, etc. just be her friend. You‚Äôre not responsible for her weight loss and eating habits, she is.

Make sure you‚Äôre using your back and chest, not just arms. Shoulders are down and back away from the ears. Wrists are stacked under the shoulders. Core is engaged, spine straight, push through the heel of the hand and think about using your back to push up. Also, starting with hands on elevated surface such as a couch or a step trainer is helpful. That way you‚Äôre pushing less body weight.
